newsitem.title: UK: Euro fuel barges boosted by pre-weekend buying.
newsitem.headline: Euro fuel barges boosted by pre-weekend buying.

text.p: European fuel oil markets were still constrained by the strength of crude on Thursday, though barge trade picked up ahead of the Dutch holiday weekend, dealers said.
After trading quietly at $83/84 fob early, high sulphur barges jumped to $85/$86 as players locked in supplies to meet heavy bunker demand.
"Suddenly everyone wanted to buy ahead of the long weekend," said one trader. Some estimated that bunker demand was as high as 50,000 tonnes.
Strength in the Singapore fuel market was also supportive, traders added.
But cargo markets were quiet, with crude's continued strength leaving product markets looking unprofitable.
Only straight-run fuel oil has appeared attractive, but a wave of early week buying cleared out most prompt supply.
